ingredients: 1/4 cup juice (apple or white grape recommended)
1/4 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes (adjust to taste)
8 ounces pasta (any shape, cooked according to package directions)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: In a small bowl, whisk together the dark sesame oil, cinnamon, juice, red pepper flakes, and warm water. Set aside.
Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Lightly coat the skillet with cooking spray.
Add the sliced mushrooms to the skillet and cook, stirring occasionally, until they soften and release their moisture, about 5-7 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Pour the sesame oil mixture over the mushrooms. Stir and cook for 2 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld.
Reduce the heat to low. Stir in the evaporated milk and heavy whipping cream.
Simmer gently for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the sauce slightly thickens.
Season the sauce with additional salt and pepper to taste.
Gently fold in the cooked pasta.
Garnish with fresh parsley before serving.
response.name: Creamy Mushroom Pasta with a Hint of Spice
